welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
# Discord Economy Super [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/discord-economy-super?style=for-the-badge)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord-economy-super) [![Stable Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/discord-economy-super?style=for-the-badge)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord-economy-super) Discord Economy Super - Easy and customizable economy framework for your [Discord Bot](https://discord.js.org/#/). ## Welcome! Welcome to the `discord-economy-super v1.3.0` documentation. ## Installation Please note:
Node.js 14.0.0 or newer is required. Otherwise, the module won't work.
```console npm i discord-economy-super ``` ## About Discord Economy Super is a powerful Node.js module that allows you to make an economy system in your bot very easily.
  • Typescript Support
  • Customizable
  • Easy to use
  • Beginner friendly
  • Flexible
  • Shop
  • Bank Balance
## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation or you are experiencing problems, feel free to join our Support Server. ## Useful Links
  • NPM
  • GitHub
  • Examples
  • Discord Server
If you found a bug, please send it in Discord to ShadowPlay#9706.
If you have any questions or need help, join the Support Server.
Module Created by ShadowPlay. # Thanks for using Discord Economy Super ♥

examples.name: Examples

changelog.name: Changelog
changelog.content:
# Discord Economy Super [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/discord-economy-super?style=for-the-badge)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord-economy-super) [![Stable Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/discord-economy-super?style=for-the-badge)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord-economy-super) Discord Economy Super - Easy and customizable economy framework for your [Discord Bot](https://discord.js.org/#/). ## Changelog 1.0.1
  • The first version of the module: added a basic methods: 'Economy.fetch()', 'Economy.set()', 'Economy.add()', 'Economy.subtract()', 'Economy.daily()', 'Economy.work()', 'Economy.getDailyCooldown()', 'Economy.getWorkCooldown()', 'Economy.all()' and 'Economy.leaderboard()'. Also added an EconomyError class, but you couldn't use it yourself.
1.0.2
  • Edited README.md
1.0.3
  • Fixed bugs.
1.0.4
  • Fixed bugs.
1.0.5
  • Fixed bugs.
1.0.6
  • Edited README.md
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization
  • Now you can create a shop on your Discord server using Economy.shop methods. They are listed above.
  • Added an 'EconomyError' class property.
  • Added a 'dateLocale' property for options object.
1.0.7
  • Fixed bugs
1.0.8
  • Edted README.md
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Now this module is including Events. They are listed above.
1.1.4
  • Edted README.md
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Added an update checking system for this module.
  • Added a 'checkUpdates' property for options object.
1.1.5
  • Edted README.md
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Updated the examples.
  • Fixed the types.
  • Added a Table of Contents in README.md
  • If you have an earlier Node.js version than v14, you will receive an error.
  • Now you can configure the update checking system settings using 'options.updater' properties in constructor options. The 'options.checkUpdates' property was removed in favor of 'options.updater' configuration object. Use 'options.updater.checkUpdates' instead.
  • Added an error handler that will work on startup. You can configure it using 'options.errorHandler' properties in constructor options.
  • Option properties 'description, 'mesasge' and 'maxAmount', in 'Economy.shop.addItem' method are optional now.
  • Now everyone will have a Bank Balance. This is another type of money, you can use it whatever you want. :) | The methods are almost the same: 'Economy.bankFetch()', 'Economy.bankSet()', 'Economy.bankAdd()', 'Economy.bankSubtract()' and 'Economy.bankLeaderboard()'.
  • Added a new events for Bank Balance: 'bankSet', 'bankAdd' and 'bankSubtract'.
  • Now every balance and bank-balance event object is including 'type' and 'balance' properties. The first property is type of the operation ('set', 'add', 'subtract', 'bankSet', 'bankAdd', 'bankSubtract') and the second is user's new balance after the operation was completed successfully.
  • Now you can manually check the module updates using the new 'Economy.checkUpdates()' method.
  • Added an additional 'Economy.ready' and 'Economy.errored' properties to check the module state.
  • Now you can add a role to users on your Discord server. Click here for more info.
  • Added a new 'shopItemBuy' and 'shopItemUse' events.
  • Now if user try to buy an item when he reached the max amount of item in his inventory, the method will return a 'max' string.
  • Now this module has a Support Server. Click here to join!
1.1.6
  • Code optimization.
  • Fixed bug with "The module is not ready to work" error on startup.
  • Removed an accidentaly added "discord.js" module from dependencies.
1.1.7
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • TypeScript support is finally here! Created a type defenitions for this module.
1.1.8
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Now you can disable checking a storage file using the 'options.checkStorage' option.
  • Now you can kill the Economy instance using the 'Economy.kill()' method.
  • 'Economy.init()' method is not private anymore due to 'Economy.kill()' method.
  • Added an 'interval' property that displays the database checking interval.
  • Now you can clear the entire database using the 'Economy.clearStorage()' method.
  • Now this module is using errors that in 'Economy.errors' property and in './src/errors.js' file.
  • Now you can clear any cooldown using the 'Economy.clearDailyCooldown', 'Economy.clearWorkCooldown' and ''Economy.clearWeeklyCooldown' methods.
  • Added a test for basic Economy methods. You can run it by using these commands: ```console cd node_modules/discord-economy-super npm test ``` The test will look like this: ![Test](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/764192017542283325/838226957166313472/Screenshot_4.png)
1.1.9
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Fixed type defenitions.
1.2.0
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Fixed typos.
  • 'Economy.shop.clearInventory()' method is working fine now.
1.2.1
  • Fixed minor bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Now 'Economy.work()' method is not taking a daily cooldown as work reward anymore.
  • Added an 'Economy.removeGuild()' method to fully remove the guild from database.
  • Added an 'Economy.removeUser()' method to to remove the user from database.
1.2.2
  • Fixed minor bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Fixed another issues with 'Economy.work()' method...
1.2.3
  • Fixed minor bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • 'Economy.leaderboard()' method will return an empty array if the leaderboard is empty.
  • Updated examples.
  • Fixed typos
1.2.4
  • Fixed minor bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • 'Economy.daily()', '.work()' and '.weekly()' methods will return an object** instead of Number | String.
  • Updated examples.
** The object structure will look like this: ```js { status: Boolean, value: { // object returns if reward is already claimed; else - number days: Number, hours: Number, minutes: Number, seconds: Number, milliseconds: Number }, pretty: String | Number, reward: Number | Array // array returns if work reward is array } ``` 1.2.5
  • Fixed bugs.
  • Code optimization.
  • Fixed typos.
  • Updated typings.
  • Updated examples.
  • discord.js is no longer imported in the module.
  • Added a 'ready' and 'destroy' events. Learn more.
  • All balance and bank methods were moved to objects. Learn more.
    • Here is the difference between v1.2.4 and v1.2.5. ```diff - eco.fetch('123', '123') - eco.set(10, '123', '123') - eco.add(10, '123', '123') - eco.subtract(10, '123', '123') - eco.leaderboard('123') + eco.balance.fetch('123', '123') + eco.balance.set(10, '123', '123') + eco.balance.add(10, '123', '123') + eco.balance.subtract(10, '123', '123') + eco.balance.leaderboard('123') - eco.bankFetch('123', '123') - eco.bankSet(10, '123', '123') - eco.bankAdd(10, '123', '123') - eco.bankSubtract(10, '123', '123') - eco.bankLeaderboard('123') + eco.bank.fetch('123', '123') + eco.bank.set(10, '123', '123') + eco.bank.add(10, '123', '123') + eco.bank.subtract(10, '123', '123') + eco.bank.leaderboard('123') ```
  • 'Economy.balance.leaderboard()' and 'Economy.bank.leaderboard()' methods arrays are now have an 'index' property in object.
1.2.6
  • Fixed typos.
  • Updated README.md.
  • Now 'ready' and 'destroy' events will return nothing (Void) instead of Boolean.
1.2.8
  • Fixed typos.
  • Fixed minor bugs.
  • Item IDs in shop and inventory are now synced with the last element of array. It fixes the bug with similar item IDs in the shop and inventory.
1.3.0
  • Fixed typos.
  • Fixed minor bugs.
  • Updated README.md.
  • Now this module has a documentation website!
  • Added an 'Economy.docs' property that contains a link to the docs website.
  • I think this is the last version of this module. Next versions would be only bugfixes or people's ideas. Thank you for using this module!
## Useful Links
  • NPM
  • Github
  • Examples
  • Discord Server
If you found a bug, please send it in Discord to ShadowPlay#9706.
If you have any questions or need help, join the Support Server.
Module Created by ShadowPlay. # Thanks for using Discord Economy Super ♥

params.name: options.storagePath
params.description: Full path to a JSON file. Default: './storage.json'.

params.name: options.checkStorage
params.description: Checks the if database file exists and if it has errors. Default: true

params.name: options.dailyCooldown
params.description: Cooldown for Daily Command (in ms). Default: 24 Hours (60000 * 60 * 24) ms

params.name: options.workCooldown
params.description: Cooldown for Work Command (in ms). Default: 1 Hour (60000 * 60) ms

params.name: options.dailyAmount
params.description: Amount of money for Daily Command. Default: 100.

params.name: options.weeklyCooldown
params.description: Cooldown for Weekly Command (in ms). Default: 7 Days (60000 * 60 * 24 * 7) ms

params.name: options.weeklyAmount
params.description: Amount of money for Weekly Command. Default: 1000.

params.name: options.workAmount
params.description: Amount of money for Work Command. Default: [10, 50].

params.name: options.updateCountdown
params.description: Checks for if storage file exists in specified time (in ms). Default: 1000.

params.name: options.dateLocale
params.description: The region (example: 'ru'; 'en') to format date and time. Default: 'ru'.

params.name: options.updater.checkUpdates
params.description: Sends the update state message in console on start. Default: true.

params.name: options.updater.upToDateMessage
params.description: Sends the message in console on start if module is up to date. Default: true.

params.name: options.errorHandler.handleErrors
params.description: Handles all errors on startup. Default: true.

params.name: options.errorHandler.attempts
params.description: Amount of attempts to load the module. Use 'null' for infinity attempts. Default: 5.

params.name: options.errorHandler.time
params.description: Time between every attempt to start the module (in ms). Default: 3000.

props.name: docs
props.description: Link to the module's documentation website.

props.name: shop
props.description: An object with methods to create a shop on your server.

methods.name: checkUpdates
methods.description: Checks for if the module is up to date.

returns.description: This method will show is the module updated, latest version and installed version.
If cleared successfully: true; else: false

methods.name: removeGuild
methods.description: Fully removes the guild from database.

returns.description: If cleared successfully: true; else: false
If cleared successfully: true; else: false

methods.name: daily
methods.description: Adds a daily reward on user's balance

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why the money was added. Default: 'claimed the daily reward'

returns.description: Daily money amount or time before next claim

methods.name: work
methods.description: Adds a work reward on user's balance

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why the money was added. Default: 'claimed the work reward'

methods.name: weekly
methods.description: Adds a weekly reward on user's balance

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why the money was added. Default: 'claimed the weekly reward'

returns.description: If started successfully: true; else: Error instance.
If started successfully: true; else: Error instance.

events.name: balanceSet
events.description: Emits when someone's set the money on the balance.

params.name: data.amount
params.description: Amount of money in completed operation.

params.name: data.balance
params.description: User's balance after the operation was completed successfully.

params.name: data.reason
params.description: The reason why the operation was completed.

events.name: balanceAdd
events.description: Emits when someone's added the money on the balance.

params.name: data.amount
params.description: Amount of money in completed operation.

params.name: data.balance
params.description: User's balance after the operation was completed successfully.

params.name: data.reason
params.description: The reason why the operation was completed.

events.name: balanceSubtract
events.description: Emits when someone's subtracts the money from user's balance.

params.name: data.amount
params.description: Amount of money in completed operation.

params.name: data.balance
params.description: User's balance after the operation was completed successfully.

params.name: data.reason
params.description: The reason why the operation was completed.

events.name: bankSet
events.description: Emits when someone's set the money on the bank balance.

params.name: data.amount
params.description: Amount of money in completed operation.

params.name: data.balance
params.description: User's balance after the operation was completed successfully.

params.name: data.reason
params.description: The reason why the operation was completed.

events.name: bankAdd
events.description: Emits when someone's added the money on the bank balance.

params.name: data.amount
params.description: Amount of money in completed operation.

params.name: data.balance
params.description: User's balance after the operation was completed successfully.

params.name: data.reason
params.description: The reason why the operation was completed.

events.name: bankSubtract
events.description: Emits when someone's subtracts the money from user's bank balance.

params.name: data.amount
params.description: Amount of money in completed operation.

params.name: data.balance
params.description: User's balance after the operation was completed successfully.

params.name: data.reason
params.description: The reason why the operation was completed.

events.name: shopAddItem
events.description: Emits when someone's added an item in the shop.

params.name: data.message
params.description: Item message that will be returned on item use.

params.name: data.maxAmount
params.description: Max amount of the item that user can hold in his inventory.

params.name: data.role
params.description: Role ID from your Discord server.

params.name: data.date
params.description: Formatted date when the item was added to the shop.

events.name: shopItemBuy
events.description: Emits when someone's added an item in the shop.

params.name: data.message
params.description: Item message that will be returned on item use.

params.name: data.maxAmount
params.description: Max amount of the item that user can hold in his inventory.

params.name: data.role
params.description: Role ID from your Discord server.

params.name: data.date
params.description: Formatted date when the item was added to the shop.

events.name: shopItemUse
events.description: Emits when someone's used an item from his inventory.

params.name: data.message
params.description: Item message that will be returned on item use.

params.name: data.maxAmount
params.description: Max amount of the item that user can hold in his inventory.

params.name: data.role
params.description: Role ID from your Discord server.

params.name: data.date
params.description: Formatted date when the item was added to the shop.

events.name: shopEditItem
events.description: Emits when someone's edited an item in the shop.

params.name: data.changed
params.description: hat was changed in item data.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emits when the module is ready.

events.name: destroy
events.description: Emits when the module is destroyed.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the money amount on user's balance.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of money that you want to set

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why you set the money

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds the money amount on user's balance.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of money that you want to add

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why you add the money

methods.name: subtract
methods.description: Subtracts the money amount from user's balance.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of money that you want to subtract

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why you subtract the money

methods.name: leaderboard
methods.description: Shows a money leaderboard for your server

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets the money amount on user's bank balance.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of money that you want to set

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why you set the money

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds the money amount on user's bank balance.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount of money that you want to add

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why you add the money

methods.name: subtract
methods.description: Subtracts the money amount from user's bank balance.

params.name: amount

params.name: reason

methods.name: leaderboard
methods.description: Shows a bank money leaderboard for your server

params.name: options.message
params.description: Item message that will be returned on use.

params.name: options.maxAmount
params.description: Max amount of the item that user can hold in his inventory.

params.name: options.role
params.description: Role ID from your Discord server.

params.name: arg
params.description: This argument means what thing in item you want to edit. Avaible arguments: description, price, name, message, amount, role

returns.description: If edited successfully: true, else: false

methods.name: removeItem
methods.description: Removes an item from the shop.

methods.name: list
methods.description: Shows all items in the shop.

methods.name: searchItem
methods.description: Searches for the item in the shop.

returns.description: If item not found: null; else: item data array

methods.name: buy
methods.description: Buys the item from the shop

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason why the money was added. Default: 'received the item from the shop'
params.default: received the item from the shop

returns.description: If item bought successfully: true; if item not found: false; if user reached the item's max amount: 'max'

methods.name: inventory
methods.description: Shows all items in user's inventory

methods.name: useItem
methods.description: Uses the item from the user's inventory.
